intro: Cyanea macrostegia subsp. gibsonii, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, white or pink flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its distinctive leaf morphology and robust growth habit. It thrives in coastal habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
